Entering in, the place was somewhat busy (roughly about 15 people) but a good quiet crowd, we walked up to the bar.   At the bar..  Waiting... Waiting... Waiting...  (5 Minutes Later) Looking around for a menu, I asked the bartender, the same chick again from my previous experience months prior (see previous entry) puts a finger in the air to say I'll be right with you in a minute.  (Um, ok, did she really just raise her finger to say one minute.) So once again, I looked around to see if I can grab a menu, then I asked her, "may I get a menu," to no avail she ignored me and went on catering to the people around me.  I don't know what this chick's problem is.  Observing her work as we WAITED to place our order for drinks, I can see that she's the only one working, well missy, it's time to hire someone else to help you.  What makes you think you can do it all?  15 minutes later, still waiting for a menu, I've decided to just go with whatever they had that was a house white wine. I politlely said, can I get a glass of..  IMMEDIATELY SHE CUTS ME OFF AND SAYS.. One more minute, then she goes to open up a bottle of wine. After that she hands over the Ipad to the other patrons, sitting next to me, looks at me then focuses on another person who walks by and TOOK the order of wine for their table.  WHAT THE F*CK!  At this moment, I'm like hold up, this B!TCH sure didn't give me the time of day and she's going to order from him?   This place has so much potential! I know she's the owner and all but damn, you are a F*cking Rude C-yoU-Next-Tuesday.  RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE RUDE  DEFINITELY will never go back.   Yes she wrote to me awhile saying she apologized but I guess things haven't changed much.

8Aq_UdlsrjhBwGWb_U-xRA.review_text: In my more youthful days this place might have had a lot more appeal to me as a place to hang out with friends, enjoy a few drinks and catch up in loud conversation, but some of us change as we grow older and this place was simply a convenient place for our group to step into and unwind for a bit.  My friends and I had just completed a long volunteer shift doing kitchen prep work then serving as waitstaff for a fundraiser benefiting the nearby Creative Arts Charter School.  There were just a handful of us so we ended up working our collective butts off first preparing and assembling appetizer and dessert plates then walking around the venue serving dozens upon dozens of rounds of appetizers to paying guests.  The event staff kept us well hydrated, and the awesome chefs from Charles Phan's Slanted Door kept us well fed and even packed up some huge plates of leftover delicacies for all of us to take home.  All that work left us drained though and we really needed a place to just sit down, chill and reboot for the evening.  Social Study was just around the corner.  We looked inside and saw there was an empty communal table that could fit all of us so we decided to give them some business for the night.  The place is darkly lit mostly from dim overhead lighting very high above on their acoustically enhanced ceiling and by bowls of flickering candlelight on the table tops.  The Social Study theme is well represented with books (many were law reference books of the kind that nobody actually reads) stacked and lined across one wall atop comfortable looking individual booths.  Their menu is quite varied featuring small bites, many wines, draft and bottled beers and hot coffee drinks served in round bowl-like mugs.  You order at the bar, get your drinks and return to your table.  The bar staff was working in slow motion though and as more people walked in the line just grew longer and longer.  I guess having a varied drink menu doesn't always work in their favor.  We heard one of the ladies behind the bar apologize a few times for the long wait.  It all worked out and we all got our drinks eventually.  The tall wooden chairs weren't super comfortable but it was a seat and all of us really just wanted to sit down.  We toasted the night knowing that all of us worked really well together and we had just rocked a successful fundraiser for an awesome school.  My bottled beer was ice cold, and we were getting the rest we wanted so badly.  As the place became more crowded we found ourselves having to speak louder and louder just to hear each other.  They had loud hip-hop (Jay-Z, Beastie Boys, etc...) music blaring in the front of the house and they were projecting the movie "Sin City" high above the brick wall.  I enjoyed the random scenes of ultra violence on the big screen, but the combination of loud music, loud conversation and other people crowded behind our chairs grew tiring very quickly.  We finished our drinks and collectively agreed to get out of there.  For just a moment this was a great place to chill.  Thanks Social Study for presenting to us that moment!

iK5oMORPCmoWUmannptD-Q.review_text: Chill place to grab some drinks with friends.  Not really sure I would go there to study...

0pb7fWD194iTqPMFAG5Oxg.review_text: There's a tiny part of me that wants to take a star off because Social Study doesn't have liquor, but that's nothing compared to how great this place is.  On weeknights, it's a great place to just hang out with your friends, get some drinks and chill out. The video on the wall is great, as are the tunes and sometimes you can zone out in between conversations.  On the weekends it varies from pretty chill to busy--but I have yet to see it slammed. And there are so many different places to hang out, from booths to tables to the bar, that you can pretty much make it any experience you'd like.  Did I mention they have coffee? Good coffee.

eKUGKQRE-Ywi5dY55_zChg.review_text: If Social Study existed when I was in college, I would be... 1) Broke. 2) An alcoholic. 3) FAT. Oh wait, I'm all of those things already...a fat brokaholic. *sigh* Part café and part bar, Social Study is a cute and cozy neighborhood lounge serving Four Barrel Coffee, Beer, Wine, Bar Bites, Charcuterie Plates, Sandwiches, and Pastries. It's like the Sugar Café of the Fillmore (my review: yelp.com/biz/sugar-cafe-…) but with a low-key, vintage hipster vibe with an electronic blue padded wall with fold down seats, exposed red brick walls, a communal table and a rustic wooden bar. On nights the DJ isn't spinning from the balcony above, 90s Hip-Hop is played in the background along with movies from that era. Social Study is perfect for a chill happy hour, pre/post dinner drinks, and/or post-movie drinks because it's just one block away from Sundance Kubuki. Is it a good place to study at? Ummm, after several glasses of wine, the only thing you'll be "studying" is the cutie you're eye-goggling from across the room. HOLLA! *Wink Wink* Thank goodness, Social Study never existed when I was in college.

kHTpRKU5ulUdDy1Lg-RNHg.review_text: The Social Study is definitely a great place to be social! I brought my group of friends here in the middle of the Ramen Festival this past weekend. We couldn't get any ramen and what better way to drown our sorrows than with some beer, wine, and soju cocktails?   I got THE CRANE and thought it was super refreshing, especially after fighting my way through hordes of people in the Peace Plaza. I couldn't taste the soju but definitely felt it soon (although that might be due to lack of eating -- curse you long lines at Ramen Festival!). I loved the light citrusy taste paired with the subtle heat of the ginger syrup. My friends enjoyed the sangria and hard apple cider. For a quick bite, I recommend the POTATO BRUSCHETTA -- the potato paste and spicy tomatoes over toasted bread was delicious.   Upon walking through the door of The Social Study I immediately fell in love with the decor. Books lined the shelves along the wall and multiple board games were sitting in shelves around the room. I can definitely see how they incorporated the "study lounge" feel into this bar.  Unfortunately the place was a bit more cozy than I expected and my party of 8 had a hard time squeezing in. I think coming back with a group of 6 people or less would be ideal. We managed to snag a table to hang out for an hour or so before our dinner reservations later.   I would definitely come here again for a nice hangout spot in Japantown. Hopefully we can play some games next time.

aqWXHhcR_CdmKmxggFOlEA.review_text: My new favorite not-in-my-neighborhood-neighborhood spot.   A great, chill place to grab a drink (or coffee or snack) - I've never had a problem getting a seat at 6 pm or 9 pm. I'm surprised this place isn't more crowded.   Pros: - Solid beer and wine menu - Games! - Good mix of noise/music and chill vibe so it's good for low-key work or catching up with friends - Free wifi - Big windows that let in a lot of light  Cons: - There's sometimes only one person behind the bar so it can take a bit of time to get your drink - Later in the evening, it gets a little more "ntz ntz"

CvFgz9oYDBX_8_UBAIryeQ.review_text: The little tables and seats attached to the wall that fold out are wonderful for creating space in here, and surprisingly comfortable as well. Easygoing atmosphere, very study friendly during the day and there's simple transition to evening into a hip bar. Serving Four Barrel coffee is a plus.

vZSm2ZFO0ryY1kh4EvNQig.review_text: Whoever decorated this place I seriously want to hire to do my house. Love it!   The coffee is in between a super strong Turkish coffee and a regular cup of jo which makes for an incredibly unique flavor.  Y I think that stands for pretty much anything else on their menu...may sound standard but has a unique flavor profile. Ex -- their chicken salad which packs a bit of an unexpected spicy punch :)  Come here to play a board game with a friend or catch up on your reading whatever it is you'll enjoy yourself!  I haven't come here at night but after reading the rest of the reviews ill have to check it out.

ccfVsl7SZeK-2Ixc2-anuQ.review_text: Fun spot! Popped in for a nightcap and definitely enjoyed my time there. Good selection of drinks and snacks, a dj spinning up top, and cartoons projecting on brick wall!   Located in a bit of a random spot, but I'd totally seek this place out again.

V5633h2RXjFcStScoMZmGQ.review_text: Went on Friday For the first time because Fat Angel was too crowded. Ordered the 2010 Zinfandel at the bar. Saw the server fill most of my glass from the bottle, and then when he thought I wasn't looking, pour in wine from a glass that someone had already drunk from. Gross. And besides that, the food was way lackluster, and the sangria was watered down and too sweet. Should have just waited at Fat Angel.

wNsSz6R73I3tcskuTv6yQw.review_text: This place is too cool! Coffee shop, bar, and study lounge all rolled into one. I've been searching for some time for somewhere that I can do work and really get into the zone. The Starbucks on Fillmore just hasn't been cutting it recently. Loud, closes early, and awfully exposed to outside distractions. Walk a little bit south on FIllmore though and take a left at Geary, and you're in a completely different world!   First off, I'm a huge fan of dim-lights when I do work and when I do drank. And sometimes even when I do eats. So I knew when I set foot in The Social Study that I would enjoy my time there. The very very first thing I noted beyond the dim lighting was the general atmosphere about the place. Macbooks scattered about with their lights glowing bright in the low light, coffee cups and wine glasses at everybody's side, and the occasional group of friends/couples engaged in conversation. There was a DJ booth one floor above, although it was empty when I was there (9 pm on a Sunday night) and a movie being projected onto a wall with hip hop playing in the background. FANTASTIC. I don't fancy myself a hipster, but I do enjoy it when a cafe gives off a hipster vibe and this place fit the bill. Even had a book shelf with books on the side.   I'm not a huge coffee drinker (especially at 9 pm) and it was a bit late for grub so I just ordered up myself some tea and got to work by joining the ranks of customers with their Macbooks out. Got some productive work done and left after last call. I'm definitely coming back here for my studying/productive needs, and most likely coming here for my eating and drinking needs too.

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: This is one of two bars I went to while waiting for a table at State Bird Provisions. The other bar was Boom Boom Room. The Social Study was more classy with a unique theme. It was like a mix between a classy dimly lit wine/sangria-selling bar and a space for studying/working. They had nice furniture/light fixtures and power outlets for laptop users. This place is on the smaller side so it might not be ideal for a party of more than 6. The sangria was probably the best I've ever had because of the sweetness and hints of cinnamon. I liked this placed more than Boom Boom Room, but I guess they have two different purposes. This is for sure a spot that makes SF what it is.

L8Om2473wuZK4LTxLL6RUg.review_text: Café by day, wine bar by night, this cozy space is a welcome addition to the Fillmore, a 'hood I admittedly don't get out much to these days.   They have some really good, reasonably priced wines on the menu and do a damn good michelada. (Swoon!)  Plus, on certain nights, they project corny movies onto the brick wall. Suggested pairing: cheese plate with three-plus micheladas.

6e7siZNcHSpocv3v_LHTRA.review_text: This place absolutely rocks. Harmony and her husband make SS one of the most inviting cafes I've been to any where. She is very much a people person and it shows in how genuinely she interacts with all of her patrons. But besides the people, decor tasty menu, the music can't be beat. All day and night they play old skool soul and hip-hop. My nickname for SS is "Cafe Shazaam" because that's the app I'm always pulling out to ID the old skool joints that I here when I'm there. Could it have a few more outlets, sure. But I just bring a splitter and extension cord and I'm fine. It's a very unique place and definitely worth at least checking out the next time you're in the Fillmore.

ZjikGmYnwUBcbMvFQ702xg.review_text: While I agree with previous reviews that the place is aesthetically pleasing... It definitely doesn't work as a coffee bar/internet cafe.. .perhaps a relaxed bar?  Laptop unfriendly (i found 1 outlet in the whole place next to the window with 1 available plug) and uber expensivo for joe (3$ for a normal size mug and $3 refills-- are you kidding?).  A better place for four barrell coffee is just a healthy walk up Fillmore at  Jane Cafe ($2 a cup with FREE refills and a fair amount of plugs for people who like to study on their laptops).  Jane also has decent food at anytime of day- for some strange reason Social Study doesn't serve real food before 4pm, just day old scones, bananas, and chocolate muffins.  Their tapas menu did sound appetizing however.  Has potential but i'm not satisfied that the owners have really defined what they're trying to be yet.

x6_8-SBS55EU4xNIjS2rrA.review_text: Nice lil gem.. Great service, nice wine selection, lil bites to eat... My bf and his friend are studying while I read

UVs_7nPjqK_W_ap96IClpA.review_text: This is a great place to go for a drink and some game time! I checked it out with my boyfriend and we played Uno for almost an hour. I ordered the sangria which was pretty good but a bit strong for my taste. I liked the variety of board games they had, and they were playing some great music. I'll be hanging out here more often hopefully!

8STCVV53bPrUVqrRI-7Y2A.review_text: Best sangria in SF hands down. I'm so glad I found this Fillmore gem.

WppPIBVK9jEh3B3L1uZEag.review_text: Social Study Recipe (Yield 1)  - Take one serving "Sugar Cafe" on Sutter. Reserve the comfortable seating and dark modern decor. Trim excess head-fat/douchebaggery due to Cellar and the Marina wannabes from next door to Sugar Cafe.  - Add one tbsp of Bourbon and Branch. The drinks at Sugar Cafe are not interesting nor have they changed in years. Social Study has a much more unique drink menu - lots of chocolate based ones, which as the rare straight male chocoholic is appreciated.  - When marinating, move away rest of Fillmore which is turning into a baby Marina. I think teacup Chihuahuas outnumber people at this point.  - Serve hot. They don't have air conditioning, and just my luck I came here the hottest Saturday in the last decade.

xrECRCkEKJkKm-dCaTviGg.review_text: Nice little pub I stopped in at after dinner around the area they have a cozy feel with books on the walls and brick with soft chairs along both walls. The music was mellow and relaxing with a good crowd of people. The crowd on a Saturday night was mostly white and around older 20s to 30s. Bartenders were nice but a little bit slow the drink selection is limited not a full bar they don't have whiskey and stick to their list of prepared drinks. the drinks were good but nothing amazing

yobL2rRTkkYznuoZBnMByw.review_text: The Three Amigos Tacos and Beef Sliders are ridiculously good.

CWxhjeeUjV5x6VvxF_dJbA.review_text: Social study is such a great neighborhood cafe and bar! I'm so glad it came to the neighborhood. For the morning, they serve four barrel coffee - so yummy! And they have delicious, fresh pastries. For the afternoon and evening, they have an extensive and eclectic wine and beer list. Plus, the owner has come up with fancy wine and beer-tails that are refreshing and unique! Oh, and there are great nibbles and snacks available, like their new charcuterie sandwich with fatted calf salami!!! AMAZE-balls!   While the food and drinks are great, the ambiance is the best feature. The 90's R&B and old school jazz music set the mood (live dj friday and saturday nights!), and a cool, exposed brick wall anchors the atmosphere as professional and hip all at the same time.   Lastly, the owner and staff are amazingly nice, helpful, fast, and fun to talk to. They know their regulars and take care of them. I cannot be more happy with this place. A true neighborhood gem that fits in to (and dare I say, defines) Fillmore street's evolving character.

-XF9C3V1cCxn19j-Rlbglw.review_text: I love the idea, just not the execution. The Social Study is a bar/cafe/lunch/dinner/study place, meant to be a hip place that people can both work and socialize at. But truly, it's impossible to get any work done here, due to the blaring pop music that prevents you from thinking. And the food and drinks are simply unremarkable.

ndnEX7tQ4Dr34ZhFSrB6OA.review_text: I'm a big fan of Social Study, if it was closer I'd make it a regular stop. Nice vibe, great coffee. Best music I've experienced so far in SF - mostly old school R&B and hip-hop. Personally I can't ask for more. Bartender is lovely (I apologize for not knowing her name); she's super friendly and does a nice job engaging with customers.   Free wi-fi but can be on the slow side at times.

cetOjQ25SGauSEkLMIta0Q.review_text: This place is radiating some good ass juju. I met up with Nish N. here, and randomly met a one Jenny Morgan, photographer extraordinare, who took my picture for her side project of getting out of her comfort zone & chatting up strangers. See her work @ ohhappydawnphotography.c…. Something is going on in this place that makes you want to get inspired, make a new friend, or just read a really really good book, hear some really really great music and/or get engrossed in a fulfilling conversation or nosh on some snacks and tea. There's good soul music on vinyl spinning in the background, endless cups of coffee, chattering friends, friendly nods, and board games, antique books, and seats suspended from a tufted wall, sturdy wooden tables of various sizes according to your studying, working, or communal needs. And then there's draft beer, wifi, snacks, art work and exposed brick walls, plus Slider Sundays, offering two BBQ pork sliders and a choice of hoppy beverage, $7. Taco Tuesdays serves up three soft tacos and your beer (except Guinness), also for $7. Lucky number 7, anyone? Thursdays DJ KBJ spins from 8p to 11p. Fridays DJ Doc Fu from 8p to midnight. Saturdays include a rotating list of guest DJs. It's like Cheers for the Fillmore. It's the kind of social study dreams are made of. But now, it's come to life. Get social and study. ps. The bathroom is like stepping into 1981. Disco ball and all. True story.

c582Zt5sUfQZxyaHyDeR8Q.review_text: I work next door to this business and been hearing a lot of good things. Had a break last night and thought I'd see for myself what all the fuss was about. From the moment I walked in I was overcome by a sense of "hominess", if that makes sense. The place is decorated like a study hall, hence the name.      The crowd is typically mid-30s or so which is chill and calm, but it seemed like most people in there were either whispering or trying to whisper. I felt like I should whisper cuz someone might be studying for a final or something.      Besides that and the fact that the are too dim to read the menu, this place gets my stamp of approval. Out of the dozens of bars I've been to in the city, this is probably the best place to take a load off and relax with a nice brew or glass of wine after a long day at work or school. I'll definitely be coming back.   Oh and the bartender is super attentive and easy going, I think his name is Roger or something. I know it starts with an R...I think. Haha  If you go soon after this review, try the winter solstice and tell them Rob from KOU sent you. Deuces.

N4GJkCdGWgxX0XJyNyWuQA.review_text: Ryan's smile changed my outlook on the day. He was so helpful and my cheese plate was absolute perfection. I felt like I was surfing on his beautiful blonde waves!

bSl6ejEd8TnZfUH9rpyBLg.review_text: Best Michelada I've had in San Francisco! I like the ambiance and hasn't been too crowded when I've been.

dC5kYsLGGoLLVlMjeMqfLw.review_text: The boyfriend and I were out on a Friday night...looking for a new neighborhood place to grab a cocktail. After a quick Yelp search...we found ourselves at The Social Study.   The space is kind of hidden (which I loved)...right off of Fillmore. It had a hipster vibe to it, yet they were playing old school R&B and The Big Lebowski was being projected on one of their concrete walls. Interesting mix, but I was digging it.   They offer a large selection of wines and wine cocktails, as well as a small menu (imagine cheese and charcuterie plates). I do wish they offered liquor, but without a license, they make up for it with the rest of their drink menu.   Note - not too big of a place...so you might have an issue with a large group, unless you're willing to just stand around. But if you can snag a table or bar stool...you'll stay all night.   Overall...I'm happy we stumbled upon this gem in the neighborhood. You should check them out soon.

CnLNC8VMErPASEq_uimDaQ.review_text: Came in on a friday night when my sister was in town with her boyfriend and a bunch of their SF friends in tow.  The music was excellent (the DJ played an excellent mix) and the place wasn't super crowded yet.  We loved the brick walls, the booths in the side and the random board games around.  My only issue was that the bathroom situation definitely needed some help.   However, if you're looking for some chill place to hang out with your friends, then you should definitely check it out.

y89NiiJC39QOwLLhTugLQQ.review_text: Really cool spot- 5 stars on decor and atmosphere. 1 star on the quiet scale. They play really loud music which makes it feel like you're in a club. Not what I was looking for when trying to read a book on a Saturday afternoon!

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: It seems like every time I turn my head, the neighborhood in which I call home gets cooler and cooler. With recent additions to the project-lined streets like Maven (well, more Lower Haight... but still within a doable walking distance), State Bird Provisions, and now The Social Study (to go along with pre-existing hot spots like Fat Angel, 1300 on Fillmore, Yoshi's, etc...), the Western Addition sure is making a run at being one of the niftiest destinations in town.  The Social Study is right up my alley -- they carry a wide array of different wines from all over the globe, feature piquant small bites like artisan cheese and charcuterie boards, and the space has a hip, minimalist vibe that'll make you feel right at home the moment you boot, scoot, and boogie through their front doors along Geary. It's still in its infancy being open only a handful of days at this stage in the game, but as they find their sea legs and carve a niche into a part of town lacking similar haunts, I can see this being the type of place I dip into before any show at the Fillmore or an evening romp at the Kabuki.   Beer and wine only, but word has it their sangria is second to none. Will have to give that a go next time!

nyXNNLKjSWtDQka5PrFoew.review_text: Always walked by this place but never paid much attention until I ended up in this area right around happy hour. Stopped in for a drink and ended up ordering their tacos and bbq sliders as well as some of their cocktails. Everything was delicious! Very cute decor, great place to catch up with some friends or a date! Music was a little loud for "studying" in the afternoon. Great spot if you're in the area for HH, but not sure if I would go out of my way to come to this bar for nightlife as it is tiiny.

gZV7Ps9eVunuUY1E9qjj4w.review_text: By far the best wine bar on Fillmore! The library decor is super cozy, the bartenders know their wine and can make mean cocktails. They also have good small bites and plates to share. This is by far my new favorite spot on Fillmore to meet friends for Happy Hour. I always go to meet for one drink which ultimately turns into 3 or 4 plus food cause this place just has the best vibe!

4RlzFohEgBdFXUGoqvpZqQ.review_text: We (my husband and I) came here a couple weeks ago on our quest to try 52 new places in 52 weeks.   How have we never BEEN HERE!? If I lived along the Fillmore corridor this would be a once-a-week spot for me. We were there about 5:00pm on a Saturday so it was dead, but I'm guessing that on a Friday night or Saturday after 9:00pm this place is hopping. Or at least I sure hope so. Get the Sanfragria. It's their house made Sangria with tons of fresh fruit in it and only $7 a glass.

q42mXysK6cirJ8ZLTCyqYQ.review_text: Friendly staff, great music and sangria.

3m_oA6_F9V2AEz0q3AOw8Q.review_text: I checked out the Social Study last night for the first time with a large group of friends. We all had a freaking blast. Intimate ambiance with a modern loft feel: exposed brick, steal beams, high ceilings, with DJ mixing from the loft area. This sexy lounge is located in the Fillmore, so it's surrounded by lots of energy and great restaurants. The DJ was mixing up all kinds of nostalgic beats - 90's hip hop, 80's mash, he was definitely serving up a hot plate of the meow mix special.   The snacks were delicious - we ordered the Board Meating with two kinds of salamis, prosciutto, crackers, sour dough sliced rolls with some chili dipping sauce; The Marinated Olives - were solid and a generous serving; The Cheese Plate with an array of complimentary cheeses that paired nicely with the wines.   The Sangria is on point. I was dangerously downing these tasty beverages and nibbling on the pieces of fresh fruit... yes I said FRESH. My gf got the Nojito - an exotic approach to a classic drink. My other friends ordered sangria's, Malbec's, and of course we had our beer drinkers.   Service was friendly and prompt considering how packed the place was and how large our group was (15 heads)   If you dig the Lounge vibe then you will love the Social Study.

RQT9QoVcQd9gnKhayD5cUw.review_text: - Locale Destination - It's on Geary Blvd and Webster St in San Francisco.  It's right across street from the Japanese town or little Tokyo?!?! (I don't know what it's called ;p) I'm a tourist, so I don't know about the area, OK? Bear with me ;p  Decor is simple, hip, chilled and almost like a bar. Coffee, scones, wine and beer etc..  Open early for booz, which is plus :)  - Gluttony Expedition - Boont amber ale: smooth, light with a hint of bitterness. Nice! Big daddy : very light, watery with a bit of bitterness. Meh for me.  ** Both beer.  - Conqueror's Deduction - 3.5 stars. Price is decent. Nice chilled atmosphere. You can drink alcohol early ;p Not bad.

QI6Hh7M68LQfMw68vLlhmw.review_text: Not too loud, dim lit, not too crowded. Great food and great sake cocktails. Friendly bartender. I think its perfect for a date night.

UzG5IHFUu6H1UyCRbqHHZw.review_text: why is family guy so inappropriately funny? why does facebook double as a landing site for airing dirty laundry? why is rainbow sherbet so delicious?  it's true that there are liberties taken when you work from home, but they can also be quite a hindrance when you're trying to get some serious work done.  thank the lawd for places like the social study.  there are no long, comfy couches where you can cuddle and look longingly into your significant other's eyes.  there's no extensive liquor menu for you and your bros to take advantage of.  this is not the place for daydreamers or severe, drunken tomfoolery.    as sterile as i've painted it, the social study is also an attractive, contemporary space w/a chill vibe.  a few medium-sized benches, stools, and one lone, cushioned seat are scattered within this lofted space.  the juxtaposition of the blue, padded wall and the brick wall is a nice touch.  i only wish that the solo tables had more surface area.  you can barely fit a laptop on it.  the highlights are: - free wifi - AWESOME selection of music  (i mean, who plays shai anymore??  a few of us couldn't help but sing along!) - four barrel coffee*    *sure, jane is a stone's throw away from here w/free refills, but their coffee tastes watered down compared to the social study's.  if you're an avid four barreler, you'll definitely taste the difference.  plus, the pretty gal behind the counter (whose name i haven't caught yet) gave us a free refill AND topped us off in one visit.  she's always been very friendly every time i've had to escape the distractions of my home.

vr-iqWWCnWcrtSNwjP_4zA.review_text: this spot reminds me of a hipster version of your typical old school coffee house sans couches and with better coffee.  communal tables, beer and wine along with internet access means this place will not stay empty for long.  it was when i went this afternoon, but the service was friendly and the music was perfect for a rainy day.    i can see how the mood of the space might change from morning to night, but all in all a great place to hunker down and get some work or studying done while sipping on a $9 glass of sparkling wine.

PMV_KKQ8HmiCLD-1SYJ6RA.review_text: Hard keeping up the Potatoes Skins N Bacon with BOH appliances:( Although, your day needs great vibes, tunes & crowd- the Social Studys genuine brunette beauty is putting SanFran foundations first, while hosting a mix table above the bar to play board games below while enjoying a cold IPA

_f50ggVhvgkqtbR3tCJhlA.review_text: Holy Crap, this place is amazing.   Seriously, I am not kidding, I cannot give this place a high enough rating. The ambiance is great (mid-century school library meets wine bar), the wine selection is great and the food is incredible! Everyone who works there is awesome, the music is awesome, the free WiFi is amazing.  This is my new favorite corner in SF.

jW24T6R4_lSFUXQZEe2Jzg.review_text: Probably my second favorite bar in San Francisco after Upcider. This is just my kind of place. The vibe is excellent and incredibly chill. Its almost scary to write a review about it because it feels like such an unknown secret but really people should know about this place cause they deserve all the business.   Located just a couple blocks from the shopping and restaurants of upper Fillmore and far enough from the sketchy parts of the Fillmore its is the perfect location for grabbing drinks on a date or after work. There are never a ton of people here which is really great. If don't want it to feel like work to go to a bar then this is your place. It is a very small location with minimal seating at the bar or otherwise. You are welcome to stand make your own seating. There are games as well for those wanting some board game action. There are also books everywhere. I forget the story but they are incredibly random and fun to thumb through. There is an attic above the bar area where a DJ plays tunes on random nights and during the weekend.   Sometimes there are random movies and old tv shows being displayed on the wall. I never know what its going to be so I can't tell you what to expect. I saw scooby doo once but then I love lucy another time so yea who knows.  The music deserves its own five stars. Whether its a dj or a set playlist in the background you will hear some of your favorite 90's R&b or even classic blues and soul like Otis Redding or Sam Cooke. The best playlist in the city hands down.   Its very dark in the place which adds to its chill vibe plus wifi makes it a great place to get work done or drink with someone special. The bartenders are excellent and their drink menu is incredibly fun. There are mixed drinks that are very rare and exclusive to the social study. You owe it to yourself to try them.   Its usually really quiet and intimate here which makes it perfect for meeting people or dates. Candles flickering dark atmosphere and being surrounded by couples feels good.   Whether you are looking to kill sometime before heading into Fat Angel or seeing a band at the Fillmore this place is the best reason to come into this area. Fillmore has always been a favorite place of mine and the social study defines what makes going out in San Francisco special. Will forever be a loyal customer to this establishment.

kw36fM-UtAQR7rT4TuLCMg.review_text: Such a cool place.  Still a WIP but when they are done it will be even more awesome than it is already.  And for a bar the food rocks; appetizers only but enough variety to fill you up.  Yum!

TxcG6Te8a3oJ5XJNZvQ5cw.review_text: The Social Study is a nice little bar located in Fillmore. It was pretty easy to find and was jam packed at 11pm on a Saturday night. The vibe to the place was really nice, yet busy. I loved the décor, very hipster. The place is a wine and beer place only, which I happened to really like. I ordered a delicious Amber Ale for only $5, which is a great price for a drink in SF. Tables are difficult to snag, you have to be pretty lucky. I am also glad there was a restroom here, which is located in the back. I would definitely come back to this place!

AUYGt1x5TuxPskCcyHq3Iw.review_text: The husband and I stumbled upon this place after a movie at the Kabuki. We were in search of a fun, new place to get some wine & cheese and we found it! The Social Study is a small place with beautiful exposed brick, great school/study decor, excellent R&B Jams circa 90's and early 2000's, sweet bartender and great wine. I would definitely go back again for more great ambiance and chilling.  Only bad thing is even w/the WIFI, our phones did not work so well on Shazam (we were trying to tag all the old school jams). Even w/1 phone ATT & the other Verizon w/4G, didn't matter. Oh well, that just told us, "Get off your phone and ENJOY!"  Please stop by if you're in the area. You won't be disappointed. :)

7HXSL_YdprSSMfpJyBh8Rg.review_text: Drinks are okay, but I like the ambiance and decor. The bartenders are really friendly.

H2FahZmg6BKHOFaLnUXgsQ.review_text: What a great find! A friend brought me here after dinner, and I was sad to know I'd been unaware of such an awesome place.   Our cocktails were fantastic (they have a very creative cocktail list, with mixed drinks of beer, wine, soju and more). The bartender was friendly, and the atmosphere and music were just right.   Wasn't there on a DJ night, but the DJ loft looked really cool--and I definitely plan to return.

UJkhP7wNRUW9KzYektCtuA.review_text: Hit up the Social Study after an epic fail of a concert at The Fillmore (too many teenagers in weird PLUR "outfits" aka costumes), and was immediately HOOKED.  This place is perfect for a ladayz night out or date night.  Great drink menu, awesome music (every song was like, "Oh I love this song!"), people are cute, bartenders are nice, etc., etc., etc.  Go here.

KEJuQUwE509pdwYUH6XfEQ.review_text: The Social Study just did it right. Harmony (the owner) had a very clear vision which was executed perfectly. The Social Study reminds you of all the great little spaces in the East Village that make downtown Manhattan so unique. Whether you are going to catch up with a friend, meeting for a first date or just looking to get out on your own- The Social Study caters to anyone looking for a relaxed and enjoyable afternoon or evening. Fabulous service, delicious food, good live music and there's always a classic movie playing on the brick wall. I highly recommend this The Social Study to all personalities and all ages- it's just great :)

fKR1pnGOWiXzHgQ-s-oCxQ.review_text: This place is so hip it almost hurts. Just kidding, it's A1, highly recommend. Not to do homework of course, which is what my friends and I attempted to do. The music was a little too loud (and inconsistently random??) for quiet homework purposes, but the aura of this place was like no other.  It was captivating: bricks lining one wall, books lining the other; a cool menu that included slightly overpriced ginger ale; old-school rap and Michael Jackson mixed with jazz; really cool semi-young people hanging out and tapping away on their laptops.  It really is an experience that is not to be missed. Try it once and see for yourself.

s6-kSU44dU3wSikEpwSf9w.review_text: I went in for a going away party the first week they opened and thought the concept was pretty cool.  I love the decor and the whole set up of the place.  They have a DJ booth upstairs and seats that pull down along the wall.  So far, everything that I tried in regards to food and drinks were delish.  I had the sanfrangria, meat and cheese plate, yummy bold red wine, nuts and olive trio, and pastry.  The co-owners were very cool people and know how to start a nice venue in the central part of the city...Jtown!

izfWJaChmgL1bIHb3-zFhA.review_text: Great ambiance and cool vibe. Great place to hang out and let loose. The staff are very friendly and quick to serve you. Awesome Happy Hour. It is small and laid back.   Check it out if you like a great cup of coffee or to kick back and unwind with a drink.   d.

am2UDS4eHmL99dEDzUVeSQ.review_text: The Social Study is a very sexy study lounge.  I can't get enough.  The vibe is very chill--a Little Dragon's "Constant Surprises" and Prince's "Purple Rain" type of chill.  With a full bar slanging Sangria, beer, espresso, and ginger lemonades, The Social Study is great for a post-work wind/e-down.  There are also good "study snacks" for the adult palate.  I have yet to try the Sangria, but it's on the bucket list.

yGK2mFojDkln8pguXcnNlA.review_text: My friend and I came to study on a beautiful Sunday afternoon.  All the cute little cafes in Japantown were packed so we had to do some yelping to find a study spot nearby.  The Social Study (appropriately named) popped up and we decided to give it a go.  I've always passed by this place on my runs and was meaning on stopping by.  I guess this was the time.    I love the pillowy, velvet blue walls with the built in chairs that you can fold down.  Such a cute layout!  However, both the seats and the tables attached to those walls are tiny!  Those seats are definitely not meant for bigger people or for studying.  It's meant for two people who want to drink.  Since we needed some space for our laptops and books, we took two seats at the tables, which were also very narrow.  The music they played was awesome!  I was jamming out to every song.  But it can be a little loud if you're trying to study.  There was only one bartender too who was busy trying to make everything.  I think this would be a good date place, evidenced by the couple next to us who were clearly on their first date (and probably met through online dating. lol).

fvPmgRm0qBs8gJHceqCduA.review_text: Good place to have a caffeinated libation or something poured out of a bottle especially after a long grueling day at work. The place has a definite hipster vibe. Low key, inviting and genuine are words that come to mind. If you're looking for a pretentious place this ain't it. It's physically perched a little past the corner of Geary and Fillmore. This places it on the "other side of Fillmore" and reminds me of H St and the early days of the U St corridor back in Washington DC. But hey, the less DBs and carbon copy clones around the better. There are plenty of neighborhoods where they already frequent. I had a cappuccino the day I was there. It was well executed. The coffee had a kick but not the dreaded over-roasted/some would say burned aftertaste. There are also  small plates for you to play around with if you are so inclined and your stomach just won't stop gurgling.  Great addition to the neighborhood. Not all great things need to hide out in the Mission.

OmLK-5oDDF7q4xmXvE6XBg.review_text: A welcomed addition to the neighborhood and the perfect fit to what was missing.  First, a couple of tips:  1) order at the bar (this is also written on the menu) 2) the Social Study only serves wine and beer / cocktails  Second, here is why I gave the Social Study 5 stars:  1) great vibe - mellow, cozy, and warm 2) you can actually listen to music and carry on a conversation...look up and you'll notice sound proofing on the ceiling 3) drinks - the sangria is just one of the tasty drinks on the menu  And third, things are only going to get better:  1) happy hour - is coming 2) live music - is on deck too

dIQnYbjf-rTxn5dQoRr0bg.review_text: Love this place.  Refreshing drinks.  Reasonably good selection of snacks (cheese board, pork sliders, etc.), and free WiFi.  Heaven.

RSLRo5XvR3uN3_Uqfc9geQ.review_text: I didn't like the wine selection in terms of quality. I didn't try the food bc I didn't see anything that i wanted to pair. There wasn't a cheese plate or charcuterie or lil nibbles or its or something. They had tacos and stuff, which is fine but thats not what Im looking for when i goto a wine bar. I felt the music was blasting and tasteless. Its ok to have loud music if its later in the evening but 430 ish, I felt the person that worked there wanted to rock out. It was loud and i trying to unwind, but i guess I'm a buddy duddy.  I thought the space itself was was quite charming, i loved the exposed brick but the wine selection needs to be upgraded.

yW-GBoKnzyduaG86Y1NLzw.review_text: Damn, I can totally see myself returning here for both liquor and coffee. This...could be a very bad situation.  But the beers and food selection aren't overly pricey, so at least my wallet won't cringe. Much.  I walked in, and I swear the place is eclectic to my brain. Random books all over the walls (though, I guess I wouldn't have those med and bio books in my home), rap/hip-hop/R&B with more of the 90's bent, coffee, liquor, and a projector playing Finding Nemo. On repeat. Pretty damn awesome already.  Staff here were friendly, but don't come out to the tables to get your order. So...order at the bar. And if you're feeling like a lot of liquor or coffee, sit at the bar.   There's just a few things that make it less of a 5 for me. The ceiling foam that looks like it's going to fall on my head at any time...is a bit scary. And the lack of waiter service. I guess its not too bad to walk up to the bar, but the bar also isn't set up for walk-ups...so I have to lean over people to get an order.

1me87I-cI8IcEe7CYLTiBg.review_text: This is a great addition to the neighborhood.  A perfect spot to visit after catching a movie or dinner in or near Japantown or Fillmore.   The ambiance is comfortable and hip.   Service was excellent. The owner, Harmony, was behind the bar and she is incredibly friendly.  This is the place to go if you want to have good conversation with others and not feel like you're yelling to have a conversation with each other. Very chill-out place.  I'm definitely coming back and telling friends about The Social Study. My new "go to" place for a drink and hanging out when I'm in the neighborhood.

mRRb8TZFCftKbuTTxx7ivg.review_text: The Social Study is overall great. The food and drinks are fantastic, as is the ambiance and decor. However, the seats against the wall are less than ideal.  Don't get me wrong, they look great, and the whole interior is well designed, but the stool-like seats leave you hanging. I mean that literally, I couldn't figure out a way to sit on them comfortably because I didn't know what to do with my legs. They just dangled. I tried standing, but only ended up in everyone's way.  That being said, try and score a spot at the bar or a table.

bW2LMBS-D-qAgXfpeof3UQ.review_text: 1 or 2 glasses of wine turned into 6 glasses and 3 hours of conversation. Dont call me a lush, but yes I loved it!  Love the decor! Bathroom walls were really cool too.  The DJ booth is upstairs and the way they get up there is through a wooden ladder. SO cool, reminds me of climbing up to the top of a bunkbed.  Such a cool place to go for some wine and cheese and meats.  The guy who was tending to us was super nice! And then to find out later on in the night that he was part owner. I would definitely want to come back here and next time, I will order a bottle instead by glass and must try the sangria.

hRD1uMCRXkpDSbr5xC3R8g.review_text: This place is pretty chill. I particularly like the dark wood and the old school hip hop that was playing the day I ventured in. I had some citrus-y type of beverage that was pretty tasty.   However, the bartender had a bit of an attitude. She kept me waiting, while she chatted it up with people who seemed to be her friends. When she did finally take my order, there was no "Hi, how are you," and she seemed annoyed when I asked what she recommends. Needless to say, it's not the type of place you want to hang out while you're waiting for a friend to arrive... unless you know the bartender.     Even though I loved the music, I wouldn't return due to the service.

4sk51VxthFOM69Z8pUFAKQ.review_text: If ya need a fix of old Heman carton then this is the place. Oh and they also have a great wine list.   The ambiance is a dimly lit extremely intimate bar. With brick walls lined with 2 top bar tables. It's clearly a couples or date night spot. There is a bar in the back that feels a bit like a diner bar at pork store or some bfast dive. But the small bar makes the place feel small and urban.   The staff was low on a Tuesday night but I can walk my own drinks to my table. I'm just glad to see a nice bar in japantown.

ojL1lQtVrFdSHmghGmWLBA.review_text: The Social Study is a great addition to the neighborhood (Fillmore / Lower Pac Heights).  Great spot for coffee or drinks.  Try the sangria for sure!  Steps from theaters like the Sundance Kabuki, The Fillmore, and the jazz places.  Great atmosphere, great staff, and great patrons!  I can't wait to go back!

Xo74xSu8RY8pw-Lfb8JlqA.review_text: My favorite bar in SF - low key but not empty, very cool vibe, great drinks (and coffee if you need a Friday night pick-me-up). Great prices too for SF. Great for pre-dinner drinks in Hayes Valley or on Fillmore.
